conclusion: Trace the path of the liquid from each starting point (A, B, C, and D) through the baffles to the bottom containers.
Liquid from A will hit the red baffle, which is slanted downwards to the right.
Liquid from A will flow downwards to the right and hit the green baffle.
Green baffle is slanted downwards to the left.
Green baffle directs the liquid to the left.
Liquid will hit the white baffle, which is slanted downwards to the right.
White baffle directs the liquid to the right, leading it to container F.
Liquid from B will hit the red baffle, which is slanted downwards to the right.
Liquid from B will flow downwards to the right and hit the green baffle.
Green baffle is slanted downwards to the left.
Green baffle directs the liquid to the left.
Liquid will hit the white baffle, which is slanted downwards to the right.
White baffle directs the liquid to the right, leading it to container F.
Liquid from C will hit the pink baffle, which is slanted downwards to the left.
Liquid from C will flow downwards to the left and hit the gray baffle.
Gray baffle is slanted downwards to the right.
Gray baffle directs the liquid to the right.
Liquid will hit the black baffle, which is slanted downwards to the left.
Black baffle directs the liquid to the left, leading it to container E.
Liquid from D will hit the pink baffle, which is slanted downwards to the left.
Liquid from D will flow downwards to the left and hit the gray baffle.
Gray baffle is slanted downwards to the right.
Gray baffle directs the liquid to the right.
